key_responsibilities: handling issue-specific constituent communications and legislative research
drafting constituent correspondence
tracking legislation
meeting with constituents and interest groups
briefing the Congressman
supporting the legislative and front office operations
requirements: Knowledge of the legislative process and Indiana ties a plus

key_responsibilities: acting as a liaison between constituent groups and Congresswoman Torres
initiating community outreach projects
responding to in-person, written and telephone inquiries from constituents
making legislative and ceremonial presentations on behalf of Congresswoman Torres
maintaining an awareness and involvement in district affairs
representing the Congresswoman at public events in the district
working with the Press Secretary to maintain Congresswoman Torres’ social media accounts
requirements: Flexible schedule; the ability to attend early morning, evening and weekend events
The ability to handle difficult situations with courtesy, tact and compassion
The ability to exercise a high degree of initiative
The ability to work independently and use good judgment
Knowledge of the cities, communities and issues of concern to the 35th Congressional District

key_responsibilities: working placement of stories in local district media
requirements: demonstrated experience working with various forms of media, pitching stories, and solid verbal and writing skills
Understanding of policy issues and ability to critically think of district implications a must

key_responsibilities: developing and implementing a coordinated and strategic communications plan
identifying emerging press opportunities
writing press releases, talking points, speeches and op-eds
pitching stories and responding to press inquiries
booking interviews on radio and television
scheduling and organizing press events
managing congressional website, Facebook and Twitter accounts
producing a comprehensive weekly e-newsletter and regular print mailings to constituents
fostering strong relationships with reporters to secure local and national coverage of the member's work
working closely with DC and district staff to quickly grasp legislative and local issues and communicate them effectively
managing portions of the office's mail operation
requirements: ability to work under short deadlines in a rapidly changing environment
Must be comfortable with and show good judgment speaking on the record with press
ability to strategically connect DC policy with district press opportunities
at least 3 years’ experience in media relations or in journalism

key_responsibilities: management of constituent mail and social media accounts
execution of 499 program
drafting op-eds, press releases, and talking points
coordinating media efforts
working directly with the Communications Director
requirements: ability to write quickly and effectively in a fast paced environment
Colorado ties and Hill experience a plus

office: Senior Member of Congress from the southern US
key_responsibilities: driving member legislative initiatives
briefing the member and Chief of Staff on all policy matters
meetings with relevant public interest groups and constituents
providing real time vote recommendations
assisting the Chief of Staff on policy matters
requirements: working knowledge of all current issues debated in the House
strong written and oral communication and analytical skills
ties to the south and staff with a legal background will be given special consideration

preparing briefing materials
representing the member in meetings with interested parties
writing constituent mail and floor statements
requirements: ability to work well with others in a fast-paced team environment
